availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Wiley P. Fowler (Crittenden County, Kentucky, attorney and judge)

body.p: Livingston County, Kentucky, attorney and judge. Tennessee native. Married Sarah S. Barnett Fowler in Livingston County, Kentucky on February 15, 1848. Father of William Fowler. Owned twenty-four enslaved persons in Livingston County in 1850. Attorney in Livingston County in 1860. Circuit court judge in Livingston County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Livingston County, p. 306.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Livingston, Division 3, p. 333.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Livingston County, District 1, p. 244B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Livingston County Marriages, Film #000318176, p. 103
Find A Grave, “Wiley P. Fowler (November 2, 1799-December 11, 1881),” Memorial #73630120, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/73630120 (accessed June 5, 2017).
